project.name: Chicken Coop Tycoon - Gameplay Improvements
project.description: A set of UI polish, leveling system, XP mechanics, and bug fixes to improve the overall gameplay experience.

workItems.title: Lower Money Counter Position
workItems.description: The money counter in the bottom left of the HUD is positioned too high. Reduce or remove any extra padding around it to lower its position on screen.
steps: Locate the MainHUD.lua file that contains the money counter
Identify the padding or position properties affecting the money display
Reduce vertical padding or adjust Y position to lower the counter
Test on various screen sizes to ensure proper positioning
Verify the change doesn't overlap with other UI elements
acceptanceCriteria: Money counter is visibly lower on screen
No excess padding around the counter
UI looks clean and properly aligned
Works correctly on all device sizes
tests: Visual inspection on desktop resolution
Visual inspection on mobile resolution
Verify no UI overlap with other elements

workItems.title: Implement Player Leveling System
workItems.description: Add a leveling system where players gain levels over time. As players level up, they face more dangerous predators and can be attacked by multiple predators simultaneously based on their level.
steps: Create a LevelConfig module to define level thresholds and XP requirements
Add level and xp fields to PlayerData structure
Create level progression logic that determines current level from XP
Implement predator difficulty scaling based on player level
Implement simultaneous predator spawning based on player level
Create UI element to display current level and XP progress
Add level-up celebration effects and notifications
acceptanceCriteria: Players have a visible level displayed in the HUD
XP accumulates and contributes to leveling up
Higher level players face stronger predators
Multiple predators can attack simultaneously at higher levels
Level progression feels rewarding and balanced
tests: Test XP accumulation increases level
Test predator difficulty scales with level
Test multiple predator spawning at higher levels
Test level persists across sessions
Test level-up notification triggers

workItems.title: Fix Store Disabled Button Flash
workItems.description: When the user clicks on a disabled button in the store, it flashes white. Remove this flash effect for disabled buttons.
steps: Locate the StoreUI.lua file that handles store button interactions
Identify the click handler that causes the white flash on disabled buttons
Add a check to prevent the flash effect when button is disabled
Ensure disabled buttons have consistent visual feedback (or none)
Test all disabled button states in the store
acceptanceCriteria: Disabled buttons do not flash white when clicked
Disabled buttons maintain their disabled appearance
Enabled buttons still work normally with proper feedback
Store UX is improved and less confusing
tests: Test clicking disabled buy buttons
Test clicking disabled sell buttons
Test clicking enabled buttons still works
Verify no visual glitches on rapid clicking

workItems.title: Restyle Store Restock Counter
workItems.description: The restock counter in the store spans the entire top and is too large. Remove the background, make the text black, align it to one side, and reduce the text size.
steps: Locate the restock counter UI element in StoreUI.lua
Remove or make transparent the background of the restock counter
Change the text color to black
Align the text to one side (left or right) instead of centered across the top
Reduce the font size to be more subtle
Test the new styling looks clean and readable
acceptanceCriteria: Restock counter has no visible background
Text is black colored
Text is aligned to one side, not spanning full width
Text size is smaller but still readable
Counter integrates well with overall store UI design
tests: Visual inspection of restock counter appearance
Verify counter still updates correctly
Test readability of smaller text
Verify alignment on different screen sizes

workItems.title: Implement In-Area Chicken Selling
workItems.description: Allow players to sell chickens directly in their area by walking up to them. Display a button prompt (like 'Press F to Sell') similar to the egg pickup button.
steps: Create proximity detection for player near their owned chickens
Design and implement the 'Press F to Sell' button UI similar to egg pickup
Add F key binding to trigger chicken sale when prompt is visible
Calculate and display the sell price for the targeted chicken
Process the sale: add money to player, remove chicken from coop
Add mobile touch equivalent for the sell action
Add visual and audio feedback on successful sale
acceptanceCriteria: Walking near a chicken shows 'Press F to Sell' button
Button displays the sell price of the chicken
Pressing F sells the chicken and adds money
Chicken is removed from the coop after sale
Only works on player's own chickens
Mobile players can also sell chickens with touch
tests: Test prompt appears near owned chicken
Test prompt does not appear near other players' chickens
Test F key triggers sale correctly
Test correct money amount is received
Test chicken is properly removed
Test mobile touch functionality

workItems.title: Fix Predator Targeting Inconsistency
workItems.description: Predators don't always take the chicken they're targeting. They may go for one chicken but a different chicken on the other side of the flock disappears instead.
steps: Review PredatorAI.lua and PredatorAttack.lua for targeting logic
Identify where the disconnect between visual targeting and actual capture occurs
Ensure the predator locks onto a specific chicken and only that chicken can be taken
Fix any race conditions or timing issues in the capture logic
Add validation to ensure the captured chicken matches the targeted chicken
Test with multiple chickens to verify correct behavior
acceptanceCriteria: Predator visually targets a specific chicken
Only the targeted chicken is captured/killed
No other chickens disappear unexpectedly
Targeting is consistent and predictable
tests: Test predator targeting with multiple chickens
Test that targeted chicken is the one captured
Test no chickens disappear that weren't targeted
Test edge cases with chickens close together

workItems.title: Implement XP Reward System
workItems.description: Award XP to players for various actions: killing predators, hatching chickens, catching random chickens, surviving day/night cycles, and other meaningful actions.
steps: Create XPConfig module defining XP rewards for each action
Add XP reward when player kills a predator (scale with predator difficulty)
Add XP reward when player hatches a chicken (scale with rarity)
Add XP reward when player catches a random chicken
Add XP reward for completing a day/night cycle
Add XP reward for collecting eggs
Add XP reward for placing traps that catch predators
Create XP gain notification/animation in the UI
Ensure XP properly feeds into the leveling system
acceptanceCriteria: Killing predators awards XP based on predator type
Hatching chickens awards XP based on rarity
Catching random chickens awards XP
Surviving day/night cycles awards XP
XP notifications appear when gaining XP
XP contributes to player level progression
tests: Test XP awarded for killing predator
Test XP awarded for hatching chicken
Test XP awarded for catching random chicken
Test XP awarded for day/night cycle completion
Test XP notification displays correctly
Test XP accumulation triggers level up

workItems.title: Reduce Chicken Counter Icon Spacing
workItems.description: On the bottom right, there is a chicken counter with an icon. There is too much space between the counter number and the icon. Reduce this spacing.
steps: Locate the chicken counter UI element in MainHUD.lua
Identify the spacing/padding between the icon and the number
Reduce the gap between the chicken icon and the counter text
Ensure the elements are visually balanced after adjustment
Test on various screen sizes
acceptanceCriteria: Gap between chicken icon and counter is reduced
Icon and number appear visually connected/grouped
UI looks clean and professional
Works correctly on all device sizes
tests: Visual inspection on desktop resolution
Visual inspection on mobile resolution
Verify counter still updates correctly
Verify no overlap or clipping issues
